title: Dirty Page behavior in XML Report Designer editor needs improvement
description:
When editing XML in the 'source' view of the Layout Editor and switching back to the Layout view, an error message is displayed stating that the changes need to be saved. The user is then presented with a dialog titled 'Error' (including the quotes) asking if they want to save, discard, or cancel the changes. The options 'Yes' would save the changes, 'No' would discard the changes, and 'Cancel' would do nothing and remain on the Source page.

The current behavior is problematic because the user needs to figure out how to save or discard the changes, and the error message itself is unclear. The error message displayed is 'Source page is dirty.'
OB: While editing XML in the 'source' view of the Layout Editor, switching back to the Layout view results in an error message saying that the changes need to be saved. The user is then presented with a dialog titled 'Error' (including the quotes) which asks if they want to save, discard, or cancel the changes. The options 'Yes', 'No', and 'Cancel' are available.
EB: When XML Report Design is modified in the 'source' view of the Layout Editor and the user tries to switch back to the Layout view, the error message displayed should provide clearer instructions. The dialog title should be improved and should not include quotes.
SR:
1. Open XML Report Designer. 
2. Edit the XML in the 'source' view of the Layout Editor. 
3. Attempt to switch back to the Layout view. 
4. Observe the error message and the dialog options.
